rules: Rule1: Provided that animal1 is protected, it follows that animal1 is endangered.
Rule2: Whenever project1 is approved, the condition that if it is not the case that whenever animal1 is not wild then it is monitored implies animal1 is released, then animal1 is protected.
Rule3: If animal1 is relocated, then it is not the case that animal1 is deceased.
Rule4: Either animal1 is relocated or animal1 is quarantined.
Rule5: In the event that animal1 is quarantined, it is not the case that animal1 is deceased.
Rule6: Given that animal1 is healthy, then if animal1 is not wild, it is monitored.
Rule7: Animal1 is treated at facility1 or animal1 is vaccinated at facility1.
Rule8: Whenever animal1 is vaccinated at facility1, animal1 is healthy.
Rule9: If person1 observes animal1, then the treatment of animal1 at facility1 implies that animal1 is healthy.
Rule10: Either person1 observes animal1 or person2 observes animal1.
Rule11: Provided that device1 detects animal1, then if person2 observes animal1, the treatment of animal1 at facility1 results in animal1 being healthy.
Rule12: In the event that it is not the case that whenever animal1 is not wild then it is monitored implies animal1 is released, then it is not the case that animal1 is endangered.
Rule13: Provided that animal1 is not healthy, then animal1 is deceased.
facts: Fact3: It is not the case that animal1 is monitored.
Fact4: It is not the case that animal1 is released.
